H0.text: Speed keeps the Moon orbiting around Earth.

H1.text: Gravity keeps the Moon orbiting around Earth.

H2.text: Weight is what keeps the Moon orbiting around Earth.

H3.text: Friction keeps the Moon orbiting around Earth.

A4.text: Similarly the Moon and artificial satellites orbit the Earth. Conceptually two objects in orbit are both falling off of the curve they would travel in if the force of gravity were not pulling them together.

A5.text: Gravity becomes the most significant interaction between objects at the scale of astronomical bodies, and it determines the motion of satellites, planets, stars, galaxies, and even light.
